title: confusing diagnostics for "as _" imports

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
When importing an external crate without bindings (see [doc](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/items/extern-crates.html#underscore-imports)), rust names related symbols as `crate::_::symbol` in warnings and error messages.

This is confusing and suggestions ("perhaps add a `use` for it: `use crate::_::Symbol;`") do not work.

Example:

```rust
#[macro_use] extern crate anyhow as _;

fn foo(e: anyhow::Error)
{
}

fn main() {
    foo(23);
}
```

results in

- nightly (1.42.0-nightly (6e1ca924a 2020-01-06))
  ```
  error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> src/main.rs:8:9
    |
  8 |     foo(23);
    |         ^^ expected struct `_::Error`, found integer
  ```

- stable (1.40.0 (bc8e4c8be 2019-11-22))
  ```
  error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> src/main.rs:8:9
    |
  8 |     foo(23);
    |         ^^ expected struct `_::Error`, found integer
    |
    = note: expected type `_::Error`
               found type `{integer}`
   ```

I would expect that  `anyhow::Error` instead of `_::Error` is emitted.
